webResources.textAttributionSnippet: (en) Portrait of the goldsmith Carl Magnus Barkander. Born in Stockholm in 1788, he moved to Lköpping in 1820. Married 1835 to Lovisa Charlotta Liedström. The marriage became short. The spouse died already in 1839 in lung soot. Two sons had the marriage, Carl Petter and Edvard Hjalmar. The latter died as an infant shortly after the mother’s death. The goldsmith and his surviving son came to live together until the fry’s move to Stockholm in 1869. After working at least two addresses in the city, in 1855 Carl Magnus established a workshop in St Lars block 79. Here he was active until his death in 1876 - https://www.europeana.eu/item/73/S_OM_photo_OMEA0001240038. Östergötlands museum - http://digitaltmuseum.se/021017414834. Public Domain Mark - http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/
